wikipedia_page.main: Robert Frank Knight was an English cricketer active from 1900 to 1921 who played for Northamptonshire (Northants). He was born in Rushden on 10 August 1879 and died in Kettering on 9 January 1955. He appeared in 22 first-class matches as a righthanded batsman who bowled leg spin. He scored 408 runs with a highest score of 67 and took 21 wickets with a best performance of six for 90.

response: *Robert Knight, 1st Earl of Catherlough (1702–1772), Earl of Catherlough and MP for Great Grimsby, Milborne Port and Castle Rising

*Robert Knight (editor) (1825–1890), founding editor of The Times of India and The Statesman
*Robert Knight (trade unionist) (1833–1911), British leader of the Boilermakers trade union
*Robert Knight (journalist) (1949–2014), American radio journalist (see List of George Polk Award winners)
